text: {{Infobox writer | name = Dave Wolverton | image = Dave Wolverton at CONduit 17.png | imagesize = | caption = Wolverton in 2007 | pseudonym = David Farland | birth_name = John David Wolverton | birth_date = | birth_place = Springfield, Oregon, U.S. | death_date = | death_place = St. George, Utah, U.S. | occupation = Writer, writing teacher | period = | genre = Science fiction, fantasy, historical fiction | subject = | movement = | notableworks = Runelords, Nightingale, Ravenspell | influences = | influenced = | signature = | website = }} John David Wolverton (May 15, 1957 â€“ January 14, 2022), better known by his pen names Dave Wolverton and David Farland, was an American author, editor, and educator. He wrote many genres but was known best for his science fiction and fantasy works. He was known for his Runelords series. In 1987, he won the Writers of the Future contest, and has been nominated for a Nebula Award and a Hugo Award.
